arm_group.description: Placebo- no active dose of PF-03463275.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study involves an interlinked design to determine the dose associated with optimal
      activity and occupancy of the Glyt1I  PF-03463275 in healthy subjects and schizophrenia
      subjects and to test this dose in combination with cognitive remediation in the treatment of
      cognitive impairments of Schizophrenia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Translational Neuroscience Optimization of GlyT1 Inhibitor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1) Males or females 21 to 55 years of age (inclusive).

          -  3) Able to provide written informed consent.

          -  4) Only CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1) No ongoing acute medical issues

          -  2) Clinically significant ECG abnormality

          -  3) Blood donation within eight weeks of the start of the study

clinical_study.official_title: Translational Neuroscience Optimization of GlyT1 Inhibitor

other_outcome.description: To test the efficacy of PF03463275 on Cognitive Test Performance in subjects with Schizophrenia
other_outcome.measure: Efficacy of PF03463275 on cognitive measures in Schizophrenic subjects.
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in cognitive measures at 5 weeks

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: To  examine the receptor occupancy associated with PF-03463275.
primary_outcome.measure: Receptor Occupancy after administration of PF-03463275  using PET.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in Receptor Occupancy at 6 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To test whether PF-03463275 alters Pre-Frontal Cortex function during a working memory task in a dose-related manner, as measured with fMRI.
secondary_outcome.measure: Alteration in  Pre-Frontal Cortex function with PF-03463275
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in Pre-frontal Cortex Function at 6 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
